oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - American Ace - 1947-11-29 - Part 3 / Royal Crown Cola - 1947-11-29 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 3 of excerpts from an American Ace sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment (7:30-8:00 pm) from November 29, 1947. Featuring Grant Turner (host/announcer), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Bashful Brother Oswald, Joe Zinkan, and Tommy Jackson. Followed by part 1 of excerpts from a Royal Crown Cola sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment (9:00-9:30 pm) from November 29, 1947. Featuring Louie Buck (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Bashful Brother Oswald; Joe Zinkan; Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Tommy Jackson
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Don't Get Weary (Bashful Brother Oswald, Joe Zinkan bass) -- It Won't Be Long (Till I'll Be Leaving) (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Roy Acuff introduces Tommy Jackson -- Wake Up Susan (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- American Ace Coffee commercial (Grant Turner) (incomplete) -- [break] -- Theme (Ida Red) -- Closing statement (Roy Acuff) -- [break] -- Opening statement (Lionel Ricau) -- Theme (Turkey In The Straw, RCC version) -- Opening statement (Louie Buck) -- The Leaf Of Love (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Grand ole opry (Radio program); Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Bashful Brother Oswald; Zinkan, Joe; Jackson, Tommy; Turner, Grant; Riddle, Jimmy, 1918-1982; Copas, Cowboy; Kincaid, Bradley; Johnnie & Jack; Tennessee Mountain Boys; Wilson, Lonnie; Pap's Jug Band; Day, Sonny (Accordionist); Williams, Velma; Boggs, Noel, 1917-1974; Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Ricau, Lionel;
